content: hey friends and fellow crafters welcome to tile escapes diems gotta here today

right let's say that before fromi comes back
here's the foamboard I recommend it's ready board and they sell this at Dollar
Tree and it's just a dollar a sheet and it's 21 or 20 by 30 sheets for a dollar
so you really can't match that anywhere else and this foam board has a
particular quality that I really like and I'm going to show you that in just a
second so let's at the table and we'll talk about it now here's a piece of foam
board or foam core and I want to talk about it for a second so what makes it
foam core it has paper or cardstock on one side it has foam in the middle and
then some card on the bottom or paper so there you go that's just basically
essentially what foam core is now what I'm going to do is I'm going to use a
metal ruler and a sharp box cutter and I'm just going to show here that you can
just cut a nice straight line with you use a metal ruler and you get a nice
sharp edge so that's just a great way to do it some people have said they can't
cut it straight so here is why I really love the dollar store foam core you can
just pull the paper backing right off and it's just you're ready to go there's
the exposed phone I love that so that's a great asset to that now regular foam
board or foam core won't the paper won't come off so easily like that so what you
can do is wet it with soapy water or I've seen people use rubbing alcohol
but then in the event whatever you use it's just really a pain look how you
have to pull that off and rub it off it's just no fun you can do it in the
sink too you could soak it with water but in any way you look at is just much
more of a mess my last tip is a warning and if you paint the foam with black
spray-paint it will melt it so all your hard work will melt in front of you so
don't do that but you do have a couple options one could be to hand paint it
with black paint that's that is one option another option what I like to do
is I like to cover it with white glue I get a couple benefits of that one it
protects it from melting from the spray paint the other is I feel that it gets
in all the joints and crevices and it actually makes your sculpture stronger
by holding it together better so there you go there's some great tips and
tricks for the foam board or foam core you know a lot of people ask me there
you go I hope you enjoyed the vid and take care
go forth and craft jeez Scotty I hope you never spray me
